meanings.definition: To suggest or imply in addition to the literal or primary meaning.
meanings.sent2: The color red can connote danger.
meanings.sent3: His wink seemed to connote a secret message.
meanings.sent4: The old clock connote the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds connote an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: To convey in addition to the explicit or primary meaning.
meanings.sent1: The use of bright colors can connote a cheerful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: The handshake connote a sign of respect.
meanings.sent3: His loud laughter seemed to connote his joy.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room connote tension.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread connote a welcoming home.

meanings.definition: To signify or represent in addition to the explicit or primary meaning.
meanings.sent1: The dove connote peace in many cultures.
meanings.sent3: The ringing of the bell seemed to connote the end of the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The broken mirror connote bad luck.
meanings.sent5: The flag connote patriotism and pride.
